title: Supreme Court Cases
description: Test your knowledge of landmark U.S. Supreme Court decisions that shaped American law and society

questions.question: Which 1954 Supreme Court case declared racial segregation in public schools unconstitutional?
In Marbury v. Madison (1803), the Supreme Court established which fundamental principle?
Which case established the 'Miranda rights' requirement that police must inform suspects of their rights?
Roe v. Wade (1973) addressed which constitutional issue?
Which 1857 case infamously ruled that African Americans were not citizens and had no standing to sue in federal court?
The Plessy v. Ferguson (1896) decision upheld which doctrine?
Which case ruled that the government cannot prevent newspapers from publishing classified information (the Pentagon Papers)?
options: New York Times Co. v. United States
New York Times Co. v. Sullivan

questions.question: Gideon v. Wainwright (1963) established the right to what?
options: An attorney for those who cannot afford one

questions.question: Which 1967 case struck down laws banning interracial marriage?
United States v. Nixon (1974) established that the president is not above what?
Which case upheld the constitutionality of Japanese American internment during World War II?
Citizens United v. FEC (2010) primarily dealt with which issue?
options: Corporate political spending and free speech

questions.question: Which landmark 1966 case established the 'one person, one vote' principle for legislative redistricting?
Obergefell v. Hodges (2015) legalized what nationwide?
Which Chief Justice presided over the Brown v. Board of Education decision?
